body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
install powershell v6.0.0-beta.4 in Ubuntu 16.04.2
start powershell interactive mode
type anything
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```
Just like a normal terminal, the prompt is on the left, commands on the right, the cursor moves as I wanted, and show the result properly.
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```
The prompt was "$<5>PS /root".
Along with the typing, "$<5>+blinking cursor" showed in the line below and moved with typing.
Here is the screen capture. https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bx_soHaLoSYEaHNkVmU4VWZoWG8/view?usp=sharing
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.4
OS                             Linux 4.4.0-59-generic #80-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jan 6 17:47:47 UTC 2017
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

Windows 10 Pro Simple Chinese x64
SecureCRT 8.0.1 x64
Terminal emulation type: Linux, VT100 and xterm

Direct PC operation and Putty have no this issue, but the first command will move to right automatically.
```

comments.body: SSH Secure Shell Client v3.2.9 also has this issue.

comments.author: maorui2k
comments.body: Amazing... After reboot my Windows PC and SecureCRT, everything is normal now!

title: 6.0 Beta 4 displayed wrong cursor in Ubuntu 16.04.2 from SecureCRT
